inference: Since $\overline{ST} \parallel \overline{QR}$, we know that $\angle STR$ and $\angle QRS$ are corresponding angles and thus congruent.  Since $\angle PQR$ and $\angle QRS$ are supplementary, $\angle QRS = 180^\circ - \angle PQR = 180^\circ - 35^\circ = 145^\circ$.  Therefore, $\angle STR = \angle QRS = \boxed{145^\circ}$. Final Answer: $\boxed{145^\circ}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: From $\triangle PQR$, we have $\angle R = 180^\circ - \angle Q - \angle P = 105^\circ$.  Since $\overline{ST}\parallel \overline{QR}$, we have $\angle STR = 180^\circ - \angle R = \boxed{75^\circ}$.
